transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: This is how I am, Denis. (pulls lever) I'm destroying the planet. (klaxon siren in background)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah. And I'm havin' a sale, too.

transcript.speaker: Voice
transcript.dialogue: Seven minutes, twenty seven seconds until total devastation.

transcript.speaker: Denis Leary
transcript.dialogue: Now you, you overstep your, your boundaries when it comes to power.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: How about a free kick in the throat?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (throws lever, sends Denis to the studio monitor) Bah! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in to control room) Moltar, are you trying to destroy the - Oooh! Are you having another Total Devastation sale? (looks at sign:)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I don't have any money! (punches Moltar in the face)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Wow! Denis Leary! I've seen all your movies!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I didn't think they were very good. (Beat) What'd you think?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs, hops onto his head) Ooh, sorry! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: My head! This is going in your file! (invisos out, Moltar drops to the floor)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Nobody cares who you are, Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Beat) Okay, okay, everybody pipe down. Guest is here, it's interview time. (invisos to desk while Zorak plays cheesy funky organ music; Space Ghost plays with his inviso control, fading in and out for about fifteen seconds, until music stops)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I like that that happened. (Beat) I'm gonna do that again. (Music starts again, Space Ghost resumes invisoing in and out) (moans) Denis...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (still invisoing in and out) Good, good, and you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mmmm. (finally finishes invisoing in) (sighs) Ah, there we are. Denis, are you a leprechaun?

transcript.speaker: Denis Leary
transcript.dialogue: No, there's no such thing as leprechauns. (sips water)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, yeah, yeah, I was gonna say.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (looks at his card) Okay then... well, that's all I got. We done here?

transcript.speaker: Denis Leary
transcript.dialogue: Uh, I have one question for you, have you ever thought of taking a vacation and - (Space Ghost is walking towards Zorak's pod) You're not listenin'.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (presses a keyboard key, a riff plays) You didn't tell me this was a synthesizer! (plays a few other keys) It has samples! Hey, get out of there, scoot over!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sitting in pod; he sings his lines while he plays a melody on the keyboard) 'Hey Denis, what brings you to these parts?'

transcript.speaker: Denis Leary
transcript.dialogue: Uhhhh... you asked me to appear on the show, so I -

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I did? Oh yeah! (sings and plays) 'I did, didn't I?'

transcript.speaker: Denis Leary
transcript.dialogue: I'm actually doing this as a sort of a, uh, a payback for my kids, 'cause they're big fans of your show. I don't really watch the show, and I'm not really a big fan, I don't think you're that funny, quite frankly.

transcript.speaker: Denis Leary
transcript.dialogue: Well, my kids watch the show, so I'm on the show 'cause it'll please my kids.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sings and plays) 'So the feelings of your stupid kids are more important than mine.'

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stops playing, walks over to studio monitor) Who do you think you are?

transcript.speaker: Denis Leary
transcript.dialogue: I think the universe knows who I am, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Then who do you think the universe knows I am, Denis?

transcript.speaker: Denis Leary
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost, and I'm Denis Leary, of course. Master of the universe.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sitting at desk) (laughs) Master?! I know one or two guys who might disagree with you. (whispers) Master!

transcript.speaker: Denis Leary
transcript.dialogue: Okay, who else, on the list?

transcript.speaker: Denis Leary
transcript.dialogue: Okay, so let's say that I'm, uh... master of the -

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're sure you're not a leprechaun?

transcript.speaker: Denis Leary
transcript.dialogue: (Beat) I'm too tall to be a leprechaun.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, okay. 'Cause I was gonna say, you're the worst leprechaun that we've ever had on the show.

transcript.speaker: Denis Leary
transcript.dialogue: Look, look, here's the bottom line...

transcript.speaker: Denis Leary
transcript.dialogue: (to Zorak) You have Madonna's new album?

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Have you any dangerously sequinned hot pants?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I have some underwear that's scented, but... I don't think it's what you're lookin' for.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (whispers) Hey, Denis! (normal Voice) Notice anything... different?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Beat) (sighs) Anybody else have any questions for Denis? (Beat) Anyone? Anyone? (mustache is gone) Anyone?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (marches out, slams cards down on Space Ghost's desk) Try this one.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (reading card) "Nice jacket Fonzie." (to Moltar) And you want me to say this?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (groans in disgust) Sit on it! (walks off stage)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Who are your arch-enemies? And don't say me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (does spit take on camera lens; audience laughs) Me?! (spits again, audience laughs again) Me?!?! (laughs) One more... (spits again, this time it's blood; audience gasps) Uh oh. (gulps)

transcript.speaker: Denis Leary
transcript.dialogue: Aside from you, uh... Dr. Katz, another animated figure.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Why don't you just launch him into the deep recesses of space?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, that's right, you're a smoker.

transcript.speaker: Denis Leary
transcript.dialogue: Who's the last person you, you've launched into the deep recesses of... of space?

transcript.speaker: Denis Leary
transcript.dialogue: Why couldn't you do that with, say, Celine Dion?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh no, I don't think Edward would approve of that.

transcript.speaker: Denis Leary
transcript.dialogue: Not extremely powerful, I must say. (sips water)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Beat) I beat up Charlton Heston once.

transcript.speaker: Denis Leary
transcript.dialogue: In your one-dimensional world, you beat up Charlton Heston.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I hit him over the head with some books.

transcript.speaker: Denis Leary
transcript.dialogue: So, you're actually bragging about beating up a man who must be in his late eighties, is that correct?

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: You have any melba toast? 'Cause that's what I want.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: I'd also like an army of rabbits, some tar, a glass hat, a book about lightning, a magical fortress made of rainbows...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: How're you gonna pay for all this?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (shouts) I hope you die before your wedding!

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: What? I'm not gettin' mar- (Moltar throws lever, sending him away)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I guess my greatest fear would be to find myself hopelessly attracted to one of my coworkers.

transcript.speaker: Denis Leary
transcript.dialogue: Probably, having to have my own... show on prime cable.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, do you wanna move in with me?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, then how would you like to help out around the set?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Maybe you could overcome your fears.

transcript.speaker: Denis Leary
transcript.dialogue: I really have a packed schedule.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We've got some exclusive interviews coming up.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's right, Denis Leary, thank you Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Big stuff going on here. (taps cards)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey! Weren't we supposed to blow -

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And so, kids, that's the story of how I saved Christmas. (angrily) Now get back to work, ya fat humps!!
